intro: Anoplophytum pulchellum, commonly known as the beautiful sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscapic gardens.
